page_content:
**Relevant Ghanaian policies**

- On 20th September, 2020, Ghana officially became a Party to the [Convention on the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes](https://unece.org/DAM/env/water/publications/WAT_Text/ECE_MP.WAT_41.pdf), serviced by the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe [(1992 Water Convention)](https://unece.org/sites/default/files/2021-06/GHANA%20%20NATIONAL%20IMPLEMENTATION%20PLAN%20%20-%201992%20UNECE%20Water%20Convention%20%28FINAL%29_1.pdf); and the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Non-Navigational Uses of International Watercourses [(1997 Watercourses Convention)](https://legal.un.org/ilc/texts/instruments/english/conventions/8_3_1997.pdf). These are the international legal arrangements necessary for cooperation towards the protection and use of Ghana’s transboundary waters.
